text: I personally haven't found any obstacles
but I think that that's because I'm very
focused on what my goals are in the game
and my goals aren't social ones if I had
goals that were social in nature if I uh
felt like I wanted uh to have always
have good social interactions with
people at the table that I didn't want
people to be mean to me that I didn't
want to have negative interactions with
people at the table then there would be
obstacles uh to being a woman but um I
don't think about it that way I feel
like when people are having negative
reactions to me at the table uh that
that is actually a good thing because it
means that they're emotionally wrapped
up in my existence which means that
they're not going to play well now
that's not true for a lot of women so
what I can tell you is that you know the
downside to being a female in this world
because you know poker doesn't have the
same kind of glass ceiling because
nobody's hiring you nobody's setting
your salary so it does there there
aren't a lot of the negatives that
happen in business where like it's you
you can't you won't get promoted because
you're boss is a chauvinistic [ __ ] or
you're getting paid less than your male
colleagues or you know any of that stuff
just doesn't exist here because you're
playing by your own wits and it's your
own money and you know you're you're
just winning money according to how much
better than the game you are but that
being said uh when I was playing in
Montana um I got called uh very bad
names on a daily basis so I would win a
hand and it would just be like a random
hand but it might be a really big pot
and the person would look at me and say
you [ __ ] [ __ ] and I'm not kidding
like that happened to me pretty much
every day um which is an interesting
reaction to losing a hand of Poker but
all of the things that would have to do
with like what you would sort of
consider sexual harassment or things
that wouldn't be okay in everyday
interaction become fair game in a lot of
players Minds at the poker table because
somehow they feel like that
because you have agreed to sit down at
the table that you have also in some
ways agreed that you're they're allowed
to treat you however they want because
it was your choice to sit down in their
world
if that makes any sense so they seem to
think it was okay to be using those
words in relation to me now that would
be a very big negative for most women I
think uh being treated that way I I I
remember um one time I want a hand from
someone and and they looked at me and
they called me a frigid [ __ ] which was
really weird um I've been really overtly
and disgustingly hit on at the table I
was playing a in a game once with
somebody who who I won't say who they
are but they they were actually a very
famous television producer and uh they
kept saying to me every hand they were
like can I look in your hole what's in
your hole can I get in there can I see
because you have hole cards so they
thought they were being funny with this
punt I was also playing once with a
famous actor who had um he was eating
lamb chops at the table and he said hey
do you want to try my meat and then
after he was was done with his meat he
lifted up the the bone and he said what
about my bone now obviously none of that
is appropriate in pretty much any
circumstance but I I you know faced with
that regularly so again most women I
think they would find that a negative
they would find that a downside a lot of
women end up not coming back to the
table because they're treated that way
but it didn't bother me because I didn't
look at it as any kind of statement on
who I was or whether that was a
appropriate or whether that was okay to
be being said to me because again it
wasn't like these people were my bosses
you know it wasn't like it was their job
to hire
me their behavior makes it easier for me
to take their money so I never became as
I said the rules of Poker are you don't
get emotionally invested in anything at
the table so those that kind of behavior
is only a downside if you're getting
emotionally invested in what's happening
at the table and poker's a very
unemotional game so I just thought to
myself well if they're behaving this way
what how can I leverage it how can I use
that to my advantage cuz these guys are
clearly sistic you know [ __ ] so let
me see if I can't turn that around for
me so um so in that sense I never
considered there really to be any
downside whatsoever to being a woman and
for me it was all upside and the upside
really comes from the downside which is
that poker is about um figuring out who
your opponent is figuring out how your
opponent is going to behave uh because
all of that stuff has to do with being
able to uh a narrow down what their hand
is and and then B come up with the best
line of play in relation to what their
hand is or what you think their hand
might be uh the most mathematically
profitable um
now as a good poker player what you're
doing is you're watching the way that
somebody behaves at the table you see
what they've done with past hands so
that you can take a as you're in a hand
with them you can use that past
information who they are as a person are
they conservative are they are they wild
are that you know what are their hand
ranges that you've seen them play in
certain positions how have they bet good
hands how have they bet bad hands how
have they behaved all that stuff and you
take all of that data that you've
collected to that point about that
player so that when you're in a hand
with them you can use all of that in in
order to predict their behavior and
predict their hand
and you're constantly updating that
based on what you see them
do the advantage to being a woman is
that men are very unwilling to change
their minds about who you are as a
person because the stereotypes that men
have about women and the emotional
reactions that men have about women have
been built into them since they were
little tiny babies so it's very hard for
them to undo a lifetime of of
stereotypes and so they tend not to
update their information about you based
on who you are so uh the best example
that I can give about that is a hand
that I actually played against somebody
where this guy and this was back when in
Montana this guy raised with King Nine
of diamonds and I reraised them with Ace
King of Hearts and they called me and
the board came a king and two small
hearts and so he he flopped a king but
he had a nine with it and I flapped a
king but I had an ace with it so I had
by far the best hand and he bet and I
raised and he re raised me and I R
raised him and he re raised me and I R
raised him and he finally called and
then on the next card uh he checked and
I bet and he raised me and I R raised
him and he called and then on the next
card he checked and I bet and he called
so I turned over my Ace King of Hearts
and and notice that at no time did I
have the worst hand I had the best hand
literally from start to finish I behaved
completely rationally in the hand and
and so anyway I turned I turned my hand
over and now he flips his hand face up
on the table and he's like you see what
a lucky [ __ ] she is she's always so
lucky you know what are you supposed to
do she's so lucky you know so on so
forth and this really came from his
inability to accept that I might just be
a better player than him and I might
just have had a better hand than he did
he had to attribute it to luck because
he was unwilling to update his
stereotype of who I was as a person now
this person actually uh I found out a
few years later uh beat his wife almost
on a nightly basis so you can imagine
how strong his views of of women were in
terms of not wanting to give them credit
and I was really horrified when when I
found that out but interestingly not
surprised because he was one of those
seword
people I sort of divide men into three
categories um well four categories
there's men who are rational and they
treat you as any other player at the
table so
